thread.title: Steven Tyler asks Donald Trump to stop using 'Dream On'
thread.title_full: Steven Tyler asks Donald Trump to stop using 'Dream On'

title: Steven Tyler asks Donald Trump to stop using 'Dream On'
text:
Steven Tyler asks Donald Trump to stop using 'Dream On' Aerosmith frontman's attorneys send cease-and-desist letter POSTED: 08:19 AM CDT Oct 12, 2015 Tweet Gustavo Caballero/Getty Images If Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump hopes to keep using Aerosmith's music at his campaign events, Steven Tyler says he can "Dream On." Related Content Feuds between politicians, musicians On Saturday, attorneys for the Aerosmith frontman sent a cease-and-desist letter to Trump's campaign committee on Saturday demanding he stop using the band's power ballad "Dream On," according to The Associated Press. The letter states that Trump does not have permission to use the song or any of Tyler's other songs and that doing so "gives the false impression that he is connected with or endorses Mr. Trump's presidential bid." 
While Tyler is a registered Republican and attended the first Republican debate in August, the real issue isn't politics or even a personal issue with Trump, but rather one of permission and copyright, according to a statement released by Tyler's attorney, Dina LaPolt.
